meanings.definition: The quality or state of being grammatical.
meanings.sent1: Her essay was praised for its grammaticality.
meanings.sent2: The teacher emphasized the importance of grammaticality in writing.
meanings.sent3: The grammaticality of his jokes made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The grammaticality of the building's design was evident in its symmetry.
meanings.sent5: The grammaticality of the recipe made it easy to follow.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a sentence or utterance conforms to the rules of grammar.
meanings.sent1: The grammaticality of his speech impressed the audience.
meanings.sent2: She checked the grammaticality of her essay before submitting it.
meanings.sent3: The grammaticality of the cat's meows sounded amusing to the children.
meanings.sent4: The grammaticality of the team's performance on the field was flawless.
meanings.sent5: The grammaticality of the song lyrics made them easy to sing along to.
